metadata.title: CVE-2014-1541 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the RefreshDriverTimer::TickDriver functionin the SMIL Animation Controller in Mozilla Firefox before 30.0, FirefoxESR 24.x before 24.6, and Thunderbird before 24.6 allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap memorycorruption) via crafted web content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-globalmenu - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-testsuite - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:24.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
